column5: I will never forget that day I was on the way to school aboard the shoolbus I always had my radio tuned to CHOM FM when the news was announced I was only 15 at the time.Its a sick world sometimes.  Imagine how many more hit albums there could have been today.

I can't imagine it's been 28 years   <object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEOkxRLzBf0&hl=en&fs=1"></param><param'>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEOkxRLzBf0&hl=en&fs=1"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEOkxRLzBf0&hl=en&fs=1" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="425" height="344"></embed></object>
His music is timeless. Funny but it's almost like when you hear one of his songs he never left us.
Why did the guy who killed him do it?
I was watching Monday night football when I heard the news. Howard Cosell called the story minute by minute, like only he could. The football game became the second story.
